common.noDataAvailable: No data available for the selected period

filters.title: Filters
filters.pendingDraftsDescription: Show only tickets with AI draft awaiting agent review

totalRecords.title: Total Records
totalRecords.tooltip: Shows the total count of AI-generated outputs that were reviewed by any agent. Each record represents an AI response that was checked and either used as-is or modified. Includes all records in the selected date range (including context_shift cases), filtered by version and subcategory if specified.

averageQuality.title: Average Quality
averageQuality.description: Average quality percentage across all subcategories
averageQuality.tooltip: Percentage of AI outputs used without modifications by any agent. Higher percentage indicates better AI performance. Quality is calculated as: (Unchanged records / Evaluable records) √ó 100. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from quality calculations as conditions changed between AI and human responses.

aiSuccessRate.title: AI Success Rate
aiSuccessRate.description: AI outputs requiring no or minor changes
aiSuccessRate.tooltip: Percentage of AI outputs classified as 'no significant change' or 'stylistic preference' by qualified agents. Higher percentage indicates better AI performance. Success Rate = (No Significant Changes + Stylistic Preferences) / Evaluable records √ó 100. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from calculations.

aiFailureRate.title: AI Failure Rate
aiFailureRate.tooltip: Percentage of AI outputs classified as 'critical error' or 'meaningful improvement' by qualified agents. Lower percentage indicates better AI performance. Failure Rate = (Critical Errors + Meaningful Improvements) / Evaluable records √ó 100. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from calculations.

bestCategory.title: Best Subcategory
bestCategory.description: Subcategory with the highest quality percentage
bestCategory.tooltip: The request subcategory where AI performs best, measured by the highest percentage of outputs used without any edits. Helps identify AI strengths and areas for improvement.

worstCategory.title: Worst Subcategory
worstCategory.description: Subcategory with the highest failure rate
worstCategory.tooltip: The request subcategory where AI performs worst, measured by the highest percentage of outputs requiring changes. Helps identify areas needing improvement.

recordsChanged.title: Records Changed
recordsChanged.description: Number of records edited by agents
recordsChanged.tooltip: Count of AI-generated outputs that required human modifications from any agent. Lower numbers indicate better AI quality. Note: Excludes context shift cases as they always have changed=true but are not quality indicators.

agentResponseRate.title: Agent Response Rate
agentResponseRate.description: Percentage of threads reviewed by qualified agents
agentResponseRate.tooltip: Percentage of support threads that were reviewed and evaluated by qualified agents (have a record in ai_human_comparison). Higher rates indicate better quality control and coverage. Shows how many threads received professional assessment.

replyRequired.title: Reply Required
replyRequired.description: Percentage of threads requiring customer response
replyRequired.tooltip: Percentage of support threads that need a response back to the customer. This metric helps track workload and response requirements.

resolutionRate.title: Resolution Rate
resolutionRate.description: Percentage of threads marked as resolved
resolutionRate.tooltip: Percentage of support threads that reached 'Reply is ready' status, indicating successful resolution. Higher rates show efficient problem-solving and AI effectiveness.

avgRequirements.title: Avg Requirements
avgRequirements.description: Average number of requirements per thread
avgRequirements.tooltip: Average count of data requirements needed to resolve each support thread (e.g., user identification, tracking info, subscription details). Lower numbers indicate simpler cases.

qualityTrends.title: Quality Trends
qualityTrends.tooltip: Time-series visualization showing AI quality trends grouped by week. Each line represents a different request subcategory. Use this to identify quality patterns, seasonal variations, and track improvement over time. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from quality calculations.
qualityTrends.maxThreeCategories: Maximum 3 subcategories can be displayed at once

categoryDistribution.title: Quality by Subcategory
categoryDistribution.tooltip: Pie chart showing the distribution of quality percentages across different request subcategories. Helps identify which types of requests AI handles best and which need improvement. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from quality calculations.

versionComparison.title: Version Comparison
versionComparison.tooltip: Bar chart comparing AI quality across different prompt versions (v1, v2, v3, etc.). Use this to evaluate the effectiveness of prompt improvements and track version performance. Note: Context shift cases are excluded from quality calculations.

statusDistribution.title: Status Distribution
statusDistribution.description: Breakdown of support threads by status
statusDistribution.tooltip: Pie chart showing the distribution of support threads across different statuses. Helps understand the current state of support operations and identify bottlenecks in the workflow.

resolutionTime.title: Resolution Time
resolutionTime.tooltip: Bar chart showing average time (in hours) to reach 'Reply is ready' status, grouped by week. Lower times indicate more efficient support operations and better AI assistance.

aiDraftFlow.title: AI Draft Flow
aiDraftFlow.tooltip: Sankey diagram visualizing the journey of support threads from AI draft generation through usage/editing to final resolution. Flow thickness represents volume. Helps understand how AI drafts are utilized.

requirementsCorrelation.title: Requirements Correlation
requirementsCorrelation.tooltip: Heatmap showing how often different data requirements appear together in support threads. Darker colors indicate stronger correlations. Useful for understanding request complexity patterns.

table.searchByThreadOrTicket: Search by thread ID or ticket ID...
table.detailedStatisticsDesc: Quality metrics by subcategory, version, and week
table.detailedStatsDescription: Quality metrics by subcategory, version, and week
table.supportThreadsDesc: All support threads with quality metrics

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: Main analytics page showing AI agent quality metrics, trends, and performance breakdowns.

totalRecords.title: Total Records
totalRecords.whatItShows: Total number of records reviewed by qualified agents during the selected period.
totalRecords.trend: Compares with the previous period of the same length.

averageQuality.title: Average Quality
averageQuality.whatItShows: Average quality percentage across all subcategories (weighted by volume).
averageQuality.formula: Records NOT changed by qualified agents / Total records √ó 100

bestCategory.title: Best Subcategory
bestCategory.whatItShows: The subcategory with the highest quality percentage.

recordsChanged.title: Records Changed
recordsChanged.whatItShows: Number of records edited or modified by qualified agents.
recordsChanged.meaning: Lower is better (indicates AI output quality)

understandingQuality.title: üí° Understanding Quality Calculation
understandingQuality.description: Quality percentage measures how often qualified agents accept AI output without changes. A higher percentage means the AI is generating better content that requires less human editing.

qualityTrends.title: Quality Trends
qualityTrends.description: Multi-line area chart showing quality percentage trends for each subcategory over time.

features.title: Features:
features.timePeriod: Time Period Selector: Quick buttons for 7 days, 30 days, 3 months, or All time
features.interactiveLegend: Interactive Legend: Click checkboxes to show/hide specific subcategories
features.gradientAreas: Gradient Areas: Each subcategory is color-coded with filled area under the line
features.hoverTooltips: Hover Tooltips: See exact percentage and date when hovering over data points
features.dataGrouping: Data Grouping: Records are grouped by week starting date

howToUse.title: üìä How to Use
howToUse.description: Use this chart to identify trends over time. Look for improving subcategories (upward trend) or subcategories that need attention (downward trend). Compare multiple subcategories to see which performs best consistently.

categoryPieChart.title: Quality by Subcategory (Pie Chart)
categoryPieChart.description: Donut chart showing the distribution of records across different request subcategories with their quality metrics.

whatItDisplays.title: What it displays:
whatItDisplays.centerLabel: Center Label: Total record count across all subcategories
whatItDisplays.segments: Segments: Each slice represents a subcategory, sized by record volume
whatItDisplays.legend: Legend: Below chart, shows subcategory names with color coding
whatItDisplays.hoverTooltip: Hover Tooltip: Shows number of records and quality percentage for that subcategory

insights.title: üí° Insights
insights.description: Use this to understand which subcategories have the most volume and how quality varies across subcategories. Larger slices indicate more records, while tooltip quality % shows performance.

versionBarChart.title: Version Comparison (Bar Chart)
versionBarChart.description: Vertical bar chart comparing quality percentages across different prompt versions (v1, v2, v3, etc.).

features.title: Features:
features.bars: Bars: Sorted by version number (v1, v2, v3)
features.qualityLabels: Quality Labels: Percentage shown on top of each bar
features.hoverTooltip: Hover Tooltip: Shows version, quality %, and record count

useCase.title: üéØ Use Case
useCase.description: Compare prompt versions to see which generates the best quality output. Track improvements as you iterate on prompts. Higher bars indicate better performance.

detailedStatsTable.description: Hierarchical table showing detailed breakdowns by version and week.

tableStructure.level2: Level 2 (Indented): Week-level rows showing weekly data within each version

agentResponseRate.whatItShows: Percentage of threads reviewed and evaluated by qualified agents.

replyRequired.whatItShows: Percentage of threads requiring customer response.

resolutionRate.title: Resolution Rate
resolutionRate.whatItShows: Percentage of threads marked as resolved.

avgRequirements.title: Avg Requirements
avgRequirements.whatItShows: Average number of requirements per thread.
avgRequirements.calculation: Sum of all active requirement flags / Total threads

statusDistribution.description: Donut chart showing breakdown of support threads by current status.

resolutionTime.title: Resolution Time (Bar Chart)

insights.title: ‚è±Ô∏è Insights
insights.description: Track how quickly support threads are being resolved over time. Look for trends - decreasing bars indicate improving efficiency.

aiDraftFlow.title: AI Draft Flow (Sankey Diagram)
aiDraftFlow.description: Flow diagram showing the journey of AI-generated drafts through the workflow.

flowStructure.title: Flow Structure:
flowStructure.leftColumn: 1. Left Column: Creation (threads with AI draft)
flowStructure.middleColumn: 2. Middle Column: Usage outcomes (Used without changes, Modified by agent, Rejected)

whatToLookFor.title: What to Look For:

whatToLookFor.hoverFlows: ‚Ä¢ Hover over flows to see exact numbers
whatToLookFor.compareUsage: ‚Ä¢ Compare "Used without changes" vs "Modified" to gauge AI quality

analysis.title: üîç Analysis
analysis.description: Ideal scenario: Most threads flow through "Used without changes" to resolution. Large flows to "Modified" or "Rejected" indicate areas for AI improvement.

requirementsHeatmap.title: Requirements Correlation (Heatmap)
requirementsHeatmap.description: Heatmap showing how often requirements appear together in threads.

howToRead.title: How to Read:
howToRead.darkerBlue: ‚Ä¢ Darker blue = higher correlation (appear together often)
howToRead.lighterBlue: ‚Ä¢ Lighter blue = lower correlation (rarely appear together)

useCase.title: üí° Use Case
useCase.description: Identify patterns in requirement combinations. High correlations suggest these requirements commonly occur together, which can help predict workflow needs.

exportTips.title: üìä Export Tips
exportTips.includesColumns: ‚Ä¢ Includes all columns visible in the table
exportTips.qualityAsNumbers: ‚Ä¢ Quality percentages exported as numbers (61.5, not "61.5%")
exportTips.dateFormatting: ‚Ä¢ Dates formatted as ISO 8601 for easy parsing
exportTips.filenameTimestamp: ‚Ä¢ Filename includes timestamp for version tracking

understandingQuality.title: Understanding Quality Metrics
understandingQuality.description: Deep dive into how quality is calculated and what the metrics mean.

qualityFormula.title: Quality Percentage Formula
qualityFormula.subtitle: The core metric measuring AI agent performance
qualityFormula.formula: Quality % = (Records NOT changed by qualified agents / Total records by qualified agents) √ó 100

stepByStep.title: Step-by-Step Calculation:
stepByStep.step1: 1. Filter records to only those reviewed by qualified agents (defined in constants/qualified-agents.ts)
stepByStep.step2: 2. Count records where changed = false (AI output used without modifications)
stepByStep.step3: 3. Count total records reviewed by qualified agents in the period
stepByStep.step4: 4. Divide unchanged by total and multiply by 100

qualityColorCoding.title: Quality Color Coding
qualityColorCoding.subtitle: Visual indicators used throughout the dashboard

good.label: Good Quality
good.description: Most AI outputs used without changes. Excellent performance.

medium.label: Medium Quality
medium.description: Some outputs need editing. Room for improvement.

poor.label: Poor Quality
poor.description: Most outputs require editing. Needs attention.

qualifiedAgents.title: Qualified Agents
qualifiedAgents.subtitle: Why only certain agents count toward metrics
qualifiedAgents.description: Only records reviewed by "qualified agents" are included in quality calculations. This ensures consistency and reliability of metrics.

whyThisMatters.title: Why This Matters:
whyThisMatters.consistency: Consistency: Qualified agents have established review standards
whyThisMatters.reliability: Reliability: Metrics are comparable over time
whyThisMatters.training: Training: Qualified agents understand the evaluation criteria

configuration.title: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Configuration
configuration.description: The list of qualified agent emails is configured in constants/qualified-agents.ts. This filter is always applied and cannot be disabled.
